alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:16PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Coke and west central Runnels Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 916 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Robert Lee, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Maverick, Bronte, Sanco, Norton, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area and The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
